intro: Adenoropium ellipticum, commonly known as the broadleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has heart-shaped, toothed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Adenoropium ellipticum is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and soil stabilization.
